metadata.title: CVE-2023-1390 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A remote denial of service vulnerability was found in the Linux kernelâ€™sTIPC kernel module. The while loop in tipc_link_xmit() hits an unknownstate while attempting to parse SKBs, which are not in the queue. Sendingtwo small UDP packets to a system with a UDP bearer results in the CPUutilization for the system to instantly spike to 100%, causing a denial ofservice condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-137-generic - 4.15.0-137.141
linux-image-4.15.0-137-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-137.141
linux-image-4.15.0-137-lowlatency - 4.15.0-137.141
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-137-generic - 4.15.0-137.141
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-137-lowlatency - 4.15.0-137.141
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-67-generic - 5.4.0-67.75~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-137.141').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-67.75~18.04.1').
